Levels.0: I never take longer than 30 minutes to fall asleep
Levels.1: I take at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, less than half the time
Levels.2: I take at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time
Levels.3: I take at least 60 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time

Levels.0: I do not wake up at night
Levels.1: I have restless, light sleep with a few brief awakenings each night
Levels.2: I wake up at least once a night, but I go back to sleep easily
Levels.3: I awaken more than once a night and stay awake for 20 minutes or more, more than half the time

Levels.0: Most of the time, I awaken no more than 30 minutes before I need to get up
Levels.1: More than half of the time, I awaken more than 30 minutes before I need to get up
Levels.2: I almost always awaken at least one hour or so before I need to, but I go back to sleep eventually
Levels.3: I awaken at least one hour before I need to, and can't go back to sleep

Levels.0: I sleep no longer than 7-8 hours/night, without napping during the day
Levels.1: I sleep no longer than 10 hours in a 24-hour period including naps
Levels.2: I sleep no longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period including naps
Levels.3: I sleep longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period including naps

Levels.1: I feel sad less than half the time
Levels.2: I feel sad more than half the time
Levels.3: I feel sad nearly all of the time

Levels.0: There is no change in my usual appetite
Levels.1: I eat somewhat less often or lesser amounts of food than usual
Levels.2: I eat much less than usual and only with personal effort
Levels.3: I rarely eat within a 24-hour period, and only with extreme personal effort or when others persuade me to eat

Levels.0: There is no change from my usual appetite
Levels.1: I feel a need to eat more frequently than usual
Levels.2: I regularly eat more often and/or greater amounts of food than usual
Levels.3: I feel driven to overeat both at mealtime and between meals

QIDS_SR_8.LongName: 8 - Decreased Weight (within the Last Two Weeks)

Levels.0: I have not had a change in my weight
Levels.1: I feel as if I've had a slight weight loss
Levels.2: I have lost 2 pounds or more
Levels.3: I have lost 5 pounds or more

QIDS_SR_9.LongName: 9 - Increased Weight (within the Last Two Weeks)

Levels.0: I have not had a change in my weight
Levels.1: I feel as if I've had a slight weight gain
Levels.2: I have gained 2 pounds or more
Levels.3: I have gained 5 pounds or more

Levels.0: There is no change in my usual capacity to concentrate or make decisions
Levels.1: I occasionally feel indecisive or find that my attention wanders
Levels.2: Most of the time, I struggle to focus my attention or make decisions
Levels.3: I cannot concentrate well enough to read or cannot make minor decisions

Levels.0: I see myself as equally worthwhile and deserving as other people
Levels.1: I am more self-blaming than usual
Levels.2: I largely believe that I cause problems for others
Levels.3: I think almost constantly about major and minor defects in myself

Levels.0: I do not think of suicide or death
Levels.1: I feel that life is empty or wonder if it's worth living
Levels.2: I think of suicide or death several times a week for several minutes
Levels.3: I think of suicide or death several times a day in some detail, or I have made specific plans for suicide or have actually tried to take my life

Levels.0: There is no change from usual in how interested I am in other people or activities
Levels.1: I notice that I am less interested in people or activities
Levels.2: I find I have interest in only one or two of my formerly pursued activities
Levels.3: I have virtually no interest in formerly pursued activities

Levels.0: There is no change in my usual level of energy
Levels.1: I get tired more easily than usual
Levels.2: I have to make a big effort to start or finish my usual daily activities (for example, shopping, homework, cooking or going to work)
Levels.3: I really cannot carry out most of my usual daily activities because I just don't have the energy

Levels.0: I think, speak, and move at my usual rate or speed
Levels.1: I find that my thinking is slowed down or my voice sounds dull or flat
Levels.2: It takes me several seconds to respond to most questions and I'm sure my thinking is slowed
Levels.3: I am often unable to respond to questions without extreme effort

Levels.1: I'm often fidgety, wringing my hands, or need to shift how I'm sitting
Levels.2: I have impulses to move about and am quite restless
Levels.3: At times, I am unable to stay seated and need to pace around
